eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork

Class CrossModuleComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork.CrossModuleComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Context, Edge, Node

    public abstract class CrossModuleComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used as a base class by HELIOS components, such as Node and Edge that need to store data coming from multiple modules. The getOrCreateInstance(java.lang.Class<ModuleObjectDataType>) method can be used to create and access instances of data structures needed by each module.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Krasanakis (maniospas@iti.gr)

      • getOrCreateInstance

        public <ModuleObjectDataType> ModuleObjectDataType getOrCreateInstance(java.lang.Class<ModuleObjectDataType> moduleClass)
        Returns an instance of the given class that is stored in the node. If no such instance exists, a new one is created first using either a constructor with this object as an argument or a default constructor (i.e. a constructor with no argument). Both classes to be created and constructors need be of public visibility. The default constructor assumes lower priority.
        Refrain from directly referencing other CrossModuleComponent objects (the one creating the instance is fine), as these can be removed from the network and keeping references to them can induce unexpected behavior.
        Created instances are saved and loaded alongside nodes if these are part of a contextual ego network structure. (Note, if they reference objects that aren't registered in the Serializer, these are loaded as separate instances.)
        If modifications of created instances occur, these don't trigger any listener callbacks of the contextual ego network. For example, this means that changes to the created instances are notsaved by RecoveryListener.
        Parameters:
        moduleClass - A given class (e.g. that stores the node's data needed by a HELIOS module)
        ModuleObjectDataType - The type of the returned object (is resolved to the same as the type of the class)
        Returns:
        An instance of the given class
